title: Former UGA quarterback Matthew Stafford fined by NFL
text:
More Weather Associated Press 
Detroit Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford, right, walks away after talking to Seattle Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson, left, after the Seahawks beat the Lions 13-10 in an NFL football game, Monday, Oct. 5, 2015, in Seattle. Stafford, a former UGA quarterback, was fined this week for a uniform violation after wearing blue shoes in a game Monday, October 5, 2015. (AP Photo/Elaine Thompson) Former UGA quarterback Matthew Stafford fined by NFL By Dave Birkett Detroit Free Press – published Friday, October 9, 2015 
Blue shoes are apparently a no-no. 
Detroit Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford confirmed today that he was fined for wearing improper cleats in Monday night’s 13-10 loss to the Seattle Seahawks. 
Stafford said he was fined “the generic random amount” for a uniform violation, which is $5,787 according to the NFL’s schedule of fines. 
Stafford’s wife, Kelly, posted a text exchange with news of the fine on social media earlier this week, but quickly took down the post. 
Stafford wore blue Nike cleats in Monday night’s game that he said were the same as ones that both Ndamukong Suh and Reggie Bush wore at times last year. He wore the same cleats in the preseason and was not fined for them then. 
Stafford wore a different cleat for the Lions’ first three games, a metallic and blue color, but those shoes ripped in a Week 3 loss to the Denver Broncos. 
He had the same blue shoes in his equipment bag for this week’s game against the Arizona Cardinals. 
“They’re going to the game again,” he said.
